Pascasarjana Antropologi Unpad Akan Dirikan Museum Kedaulatan Pangan Masyarakat Jabar
07 Nov 2019, 10:10 by Catur Ratna Wulandari
BANDUNG, (PR).- Program Studi Pascasarjana Antropologi Universitas Padjadjaran tengah merancang pendirian museum kedaulatan pangan masyarakat Sunda. Museum tersebut direncanakan bisa menjadi pusat rujukan bagi siapapun yang memerlukan informasi tentang pangan di Jawa Barat.Dosen Antropologi Unpad Budi Rajab mengatakan, sebelum pendirian museum itu, digelar seminar tentang ketahanan pangan pada akhir November ini. "Tidak hanya soal makanan, tapi segala sesuatu yang berkaitan dengan kedaulatan pangan," kata Budi saat berkunjung ke Redaksi Pikiran Rakyat di Jalan Asia Afrika 77 Bandung, Kamis 7 November 2019.Seminar ini diselenggarakan bekerja sama dengan Direktorat Jenderal Kebudayaan Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan. Beberapa tokoh yang direncanakan hadir dan berbicara dalam seminar ini antara lain Dirjen Kebudayaan Hilmar Farid, budayawan Ajin Rosidi, dan Guru Besar Sejarah Unpad.Ketua Program Studi Pascasarjana Antropologi Unpad Rini Soemarwoto mengatakan, dalam seminar tersebut akan membahas beberapa hal, antara lain perubahan budaya Sunda, perubahan wilyah, ketahanan pangan Jawa Barat, serta kemuseuman. "Dari seminar itu kemudian akan dipecah menjadi empat FGD (Forum Group Discussion) supaya bisa membuat rumusan-rumusan terkait pembentukan museum ini," katanya.Ia mengatakan, soal kedaulatan pangan ini mengandung berbagai dimensi penting. Saat ini masyarakat cenderung memperhatikan kemampuan memenuhi kebutuhan pangannya. "Belum soal makan yang sehat," ujarnya.Soal pangan ini, kata dia, juga tak bisa lepas dari konteks masyarakat saat itu. Perubahan yang terjadi tak lepas dari kondisi sosial yang melingkupinya. "Setiap masa punya konteksnya yang terlihat di (pemberitaan) media," katanya.Oleh karenanya, Pikiran Rakyat diharapkan bisa turut serta menyumbangkan berbagai informasi yang Â telah dikumpulkan selama beberapa dekade. Baik berupa, teks, foto, maupun data lain yang terkait.Salah seorang anggota tim pembentukan museum ini, Fajar Abadi Ramadhan Dwi Putra mengatakan, museum tersebut harapannya bisa menjadi media center. "Siapa saja yang ingin mengakses pengetahuan tentang kedaulatan pangan masyarakat Sunda ini bisa ke museum. Selain dipajang juga diharapkan ada perpustakaan, kelas, program, dan diskusi. Melibatkan berbagai sumber-sumber," tuturnya.Budi menambahkan, Pikiran Rakyat merupakan salah satu media yang menaruh perhatian pada isu pertanian yang erat kaitannya dengan pangan. Harapannya, Pikiran Rakyat bisa menjadi mitra dalam mewujudkan museum ini.Direktur Utama Pikiran Rakyat Perdana Alamsyah menyambut baik rencana ini. Pikiran Rakyat akan berupaya berkontribusi dalam menyediakan informasi yang diperlukan.***

Postgraduate Anthropology Unpad Will Establish West Java Community Food Sovereignty Museum
Nov 7 2019, 10:10 by Catur Ratna Wulandari
BANDUNG, (PR) .- The Postgraduate Anthropology Study Program of Padjadjaran University is designing the establishment of the Sundanese food sovereignty museum. The museum is planned to be a reference center for anyone who needs information about food in West Java. Unpad Anthropology Lecturer Budi Rajab said, before the establishment of the museum, a seminar on food security was held at the end of this November. "It's not just about food, but everything related to food sovereignty," Budi said during a visit to the People's Mind Editor at Jalan Asia Afrika 77 Bandung, Thursday, November 7, 2019. The seminar was held in collaboration with the Directorate General of Culture Ministry of Education and Culture. Several figures planned to attend and speak at the seminar include the Director General of Culture Hilmar Farid, cultural observer Ajin Rosidi, and Professor of Unpad History. Head of the Unpad Anthropology Postgraduate Study Program Rini Soemarwoto said, the seminar would discuss several things, including changes in Sundanese culture. , regional change, West Java food security, and museums. "From the seminar will then be divided into four FGDs (Forum Group Discussion) so that they can make formulations related to the formation of this museum," he said. He said, the matter of food sovereignty contained various important dimensions. Nowadays people tend to pay attention to their ability to meet their food needs. "Not yet about healthy eating," he said. This food problem, he said, also could not be separated from the context of the community at that time. The changes that occur cannot be separated from the social conditions that surround them. "Every time has a context that is visible in (the news) of the media," he said. Therefore, the People's Mind is expected to be able to contribute various information that has been collected for decades. Both in the form, text, photos, and other related data. A member of the museum's formation team, Fajar Abadi Ramadhan Dwi Putra said the museum hopes to become a media center. "Anyone who wants to access knowledge about the food sovereignty of the Sundanese people can go to the museum. Besides being on display, it is also expected to have a library, classes, programs and discussions. Involving various sources," he said. Budi added, People's Mind is one of the media that pay attention to the issue of agriculture which is closely related to food. The hope, People's Thoughts can become partners in realizing this museum. Principal Director of People's Thoughts Perdana Alamsyah welcomed this plan. People's Mind will try to contribute in providing the information needed. ***
